com.harambe.algorithm

Class MiniMax

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.harambe.algorithm.MiniMax

  • public class MiniMax
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation for the MiniMax algorithm with alpha beta pruning and iterative deepening. Requires use of the Board class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private int alphabeta(Board board, int depth, int alpha, int beta, boolean isMaximizingPlayer)
      Do NOT call directly, use getBestMove In MiniMax the minplayer (our enemy) tries to minimize our "advantage" / win chance the maxplayer (our AI) tries to maximize our win chances alpha beta cuts of the trees that aren't being chosen from the enemy / us anyways, explained here: http://www.emunix.emich.edu/~evett/AI/AlphaBeta_movie/sld009.htm
      private java.lang.String convertGridToKey(char[][] grid)
      turns board grid into database key format

      switches each Player tile on the Board to the other player

    • Constructor Detail

      • MiniMax

        public MiniMax(char optimizingPlayer,
               long maxMilis)
        Parameters:
        optimizingPlayer - the symbol of the player (usually the AI), defined in Board class
        maxMilis - maximum miliseconds until function returns, 0 for infinity. Keep in mind that this doesn't represent the whole runtime of the best move function. The real runtime is maxMilis + the timeOutDepth run

    • Method Detail

      • switchPlayerInKey

        private java.lang.String switchPlayerInKey(java.lang.String key)
        switches each Player tile on the Board to the other player
        Parameters:
        key - String representation of the Board that works as a key for the database
        Returns:
        String representation of the player-swapped board that works as a key for the database

      • mirrorKey

        private java.lang.String mirrorKey(java.lang.String key)
        Flips the board along the central column.
        Parameters:
        key - String representation of the Board that works as a key for the database
        Returns:
        String representation of the mirrored board that works as a key for the database

      • convertGridToKey

        private java.lang.String convertGridToKey(char[][] grid)
        turns board grid into database key format
        Parameters:
        grid - 2d array grid char[Board.ROWS][Board.COLUMNS]
        Returns:
        String representation of the current Board that works as a key for the database

      • getBestMove

        public int getBestMove(Board board)
        Parameters:
        board - Board object with 2d array grid char[Board.ROWS][Board.COLUMNS]
        Returns:
        best column to put the next play in (starting at 0 being leftmost column) -1 indicates a finished game state

      • timeLeft

        private boolean timeLeft()

      • alphabeta

        private int alphabeta(Board board,
                      int depth,
                      int alpha,
                      int beta,
                      boolean isMaximizingPlayer)
               throws OutOfTimeException
        Do NOT call directly, use getBestMove In MiniMax the minplayer (our enemy) tries to minimize our "advantage" / win chance the maxplayer (our AI) tries to maximize our win chances alpha beta cuts of the trees that aren't being chosen from the enemy / us anyways, explained here: http://www.emunix.emich.edu/~evett/AI/AlphaBeta_movie/sld009.htm
        Parameters:
        board - 2d char array with char[Board.ROWS][Board.COLUMNS]
        depth - how many node-levels will be search (decreases performance)
        alpha - initial call: -infinity; value that max-player (we) will receive as a minimum
        beta - initial call: +infinity; value that min-player (enemy) will receive at max
        isMaximizingPlayer - MiniMax player type (initial call = true)
        Returns:
        score of the move, only used within the recursion the evaluate moves
        Throws:
        OutOfTimeException

      • evalValue

        private int evalValue(Board board,
                      int depth)
        Evaluation function for the MiniMax algorithm
        Parameters:
        board - 2d char array with char[Board.ROWS][Board.COLUMNS]
        Returns:
        value of the checked board for max player (higher = better)
